intro: Matelea tarrazuana, commonly known as the Tarrazú matelea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, typical of the family. Matelea tarrazuana is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
